title: Strain Formula
text: Recall the formula for strain: ΔL $$=$$ $$\frac{F L_0}{A Y}$$, where ΔL is the change in length, F the applied force, Y is a factor, called the elastic modulus or Young’s modulus, that depends on the substance, A is the cross-sectional area, and $$L_0$$ is the original length.

title: Plug In and Solve for the Change in Length
text: What is $$0.006\frac{4\frac{1}{1\times{10}^9}}{\pi \left(0.5\times0.0005\right)^2}$$ (in mm, rounded to nearest whole number)?
